docs.lead_paragraph: The way to pass health care is for the president to praise Republicans until he scares them to death.
docs.snippet: The way to pass health care is for the president to praise Republicans until he scares them to death.

docs.lead_paragraph: It's not surprising that the health care legislation that the late Senator Edward M. Kennedy spent years fighting for has become a large issue in the campaign for his Senate seat. The unexpected part is that two candidates are fighting about whether or not to support the legislation. The Massachusetts attorney general, Martha Coakley, the current front-runner, said she opposed the health care bill that the House approved last weekend, because it contains an amendment prohibiting federal health care plans from covering abortions.
docs.abstract: Health care legislation has become big issue in campaign for Senate seat of late Sen Edward Kennedy; current front-runner Martha Coakley and Rep Michael Capuano, one of her three rivals, both oppose House measure because it would prohibit federal health care plans from covering abortions (S)
docs.snippet: It's not surprising that the health care legislation that the late Senator Edward M. Kennedy spent years fighting for has become a large issue in the campaign for his Senate seat. The unexpected part is that two candidates are fighting about whether...

docs.lead_paragraph: Abortion will not be the only social issue dividing Congress as it seeks to construct a compromise health care bill capable of passing both houses. The bill the House passed on Saturday also sets up a confrontation with the Senate over how much access illegal immigrants should have to public resources. In this case, the public resource is a government-run health insurance exchange, or marketplace, intended to give consumers more affordable coverage by letting them comparison shop.
docs.abstract: Health care reform bill passed by House sets up confrontation with Senate over how much access illegal immigrants should have to government-run health insurance exchange intended to give consumers more affordable coverage by allowing them to comparison shop; differences in House and Senate versions noted (S)
docs.snippet: Abortion will not be the only social issue dividing Congress as it seeks to construct a compromise health care bill capable of passing both houses. The bill the House passed on Saturday also sets up a  confrontation with the Senate over how much...

docs.lead_paragraph: I'm theoretically on vacation, peddling my book on book tour, but with health care reform in the balance I just couldn't bear to stay away from the fray. So I frantically sent last-minute word that I would file my column after all, and my Thursday column tries to compare the choices on health reform and Afghan troop deployments.

headline.main: Where To Spend $100 Billion, Health or Helmand?

docs.abstract: The cost of health care reform and of troops in Afghanistan is similar, about $100 billion a year. But health reform is far more central to America's security.
docs.snippet: The cost of health care reform and of troops in Afghanistan is similar, about $100 billion a year. But health reform is far more central to America's security.

docs.lead_paragraph: ST. LOUIS - So long as Budweiser, the King of Beers, was enthroned in this pleasant and nobly resilient middle American city, the blows of corporate condescension from the other giants who abandoned the Gateway Arch could be endured.
docs.abstract: If last year's sale of Anheuser-Busch -- and Budweiser! -- to a European brewer was a hint that a social contract had been broken, the evidence has only been piling up since then.
docs.snippet: If last year's sale of Anheuser-Busch -- and Budweiser! -- to a European brewer was a hint that a social contract had been broken, the evidence has only been piling up since then.

docs.lead_paragraph: Abortion will not be the only social issue dividing Congress as it seeks to construct a compromise health care bill capable of passing both houses. The legislation the House passed on Saturday by a narrow margin also sets up a looming confrontation with the Senate over the extent to which illegal immigrants should have access to public resources.

headline.main: Illegal Immigration May Be a Rift Issue

docs.abstract: The issue of illegal immigrants could be another issue that, along with abortion, creates friction between the House and Senate versions of health care legislation.
docs.snippet: The issue of illegal immigrants could be another issue that, along with abortion, creates friction between the House and Senate versions of health care legislation.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gail Collins: David, when I watched the House of Representatives pass the health care bill over the weekend, I felt the same combination of depression and awe I generally get when I watch Congress do something large. So ambitious! So deeply flawed! Why isn't it better? But how did they ever manage to get it done?

headline.main: Awed and Depressed by a Health Care Bill

docs.abstract: Why Congress -- and Joe Lieberman -- are driving Gail Collins crazy.
docs.snippet: Why Congress -- and Joe Lieberman -- are driving Gail Collins crazy.
